SEARCH
Module AM08
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
this class is the main class of the model : it contains the methods called by the Controller and in this class there are all the methods that implement the logic of the game (check of a move, the logic of the turns, the final leaderboard ...)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameModel(int numPlayers, List<String> nicknames)
    this method is the class constructor : it creates a new GameMode object
    GameModel(GameModel gameModel)
    This constructor copies the gameModel when loaded from file.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(int numPlayers, List<String> nicknames)
      this method is the class constructor : it creates a new GameMode object
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - number of players for the game
      nicknames - players' nicknames

    • GameModel

      public GameModel(GameModel gameModel)
      This constructor copies the gameModel when loaded from file. Note that it copies the reference, but it is fine because when the object is loaded from file GSON creates a new instance of the object, so even if we copy by reference it is fine We could also avoid implementing it
      Parameters:
      gameModel - copy of the gameModel we want

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(List<Position> pos, int col)
      this method represents the move done by a player: the player removes from 1 to 3 tile from the game board and adds the tiles in his shelf, in the specific column. We don't check if the positions in the list are correct because we assumed the positions in the list are already check(by method checkValidMove).We assume the same for the column;
      Parameters:
      pos - : list of position chosen by the player (tiles chosen by the player)
      col - : column chosen by the player

    • checkValidMove

      public boolean checkValidMove(List<Position> pos)
      this method is used to check if the move done by the current player is correct, according to the rules of the game
      Parameters:
      pos - list of the position of the tiles taken by the player from the gameBoard
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false if the move isn't valid

    • checkValidColumn

      public boolean checkValidColumn(int col, int numTiles)
      this method is used to verify if the column col has free spaces to put the tiles taken from the game board
      Parameters:
      col - column where the player wants to put the tiles
      numTiles - number of tiles taken by the player from the game board
      Returns:
      true if there is space in the column, false if there isn't space in the column

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      This method represents the logic of the turns: is used to update the currentPlayer and evaluate the points of the currentPlayer. It also checks at the end of the turn if the board has to be filled

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public int getCurrentPlayer()
      this method return the current player
      Returns:
      an int, the current player

      public boolean isGameOver()
      this method returns true if the game is over, false otherwise
      Returns:
      a boolean which is the value of the attribute gameOver

    • forceEndGame

      public void forceEndGame(boolean forced)
      This method forces and end to the game
      Parameters:
      forced - true if forced from outside

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      This method overrides the method equals. it assumes that two gameModel are equals if they have the same attributes; if the parameter passed by parameter isn't a gameModel, the method returns false
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check
      Returns:
      true if the gameModel are equals
